intro: Willoughbya scandens var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy climbing willow. It is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia, characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and flexible stems. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a velvety texture. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
